Reviews.Title: “HRC hotel - a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ybyuan2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 22/ 08/2012 for 4 night. So what I am going to say here is a real updated one. The hotel located in a nice quiet area although it is not very far from the main arractions. The bathroom is big and clean, plenty of hot water whenever you want to take shower. It says free WI-FI everywhere in the hotel but since our room is in the corner at first first, hence the singal in the room was very weak. I need to go to the corridor or the lobby to get internet connection. But it didn't bother me at all as you don't sit in your room to explore the internet all day long while you are on holiday. Only 5-10 minutes walk to Royal Palace, My partner and I walked to Gran Via (the heart of city center)almost everyday. If you wanted to go to Plaza de Toros (Bullring arena) take the red metro from Opera to Ventos(its the easiest way you don't need to change). You will see the Plaza when you come out from the metro. We bought 10 trips mentro tickets at airport for Euro 18 for two. Actually we didn't finish it because we walked to everywhere. There is a club on the groudfloor. I was worried the noise when I read some reviews here. To be honest I didn't hear anything but my partner told me he couldn't sleep well only for one night because of the noise. But overall he is happy for his stay too. We would recommend this hotel for everyone because it is in good location, nice friendly staff, free WI-FI., big bathroom, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good service”
Reviews.Author: Naxrupa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located not far from the center - just few minutes from Royal palace and Calle Mayor. We had nice cathedral view from our 3rd floor. Bathroom is clean, room is not very big, but cosy. We had heard some noise from other rooms but it hadn't disturbed us. Wi-Fi is free and mini-bar is also free (while booking via hotel website) The price was reasonable, so we were satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Degan W
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the location and we were quite pleased with it - walking distance to museums and very close to the Calle de la Cava Baja and good tapas - but the decor in the rooms were strangely quirky and it was quite loud The cafeteria on the first floor is not too bad though and the people who run it are very kind. Secure parking.

Reviews.Title: “Solid option in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: GrunerVeltiner
Reviews.Content: HRC Hotel was a good value for a short stay in Madrid. The hotel staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, and it was a short walk to the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, and the charming, tapas-bar-filled streets of the La Latina neighborhood. We heard weekend partyers' late-night singing a few times, but nothing too disruptive. For those with a car: there was parking available (for 20 Euro/day), but the garage entrance ramp and the parking space itself were so tiny we couldn't use it and ended up having to pay 28 Euro/day for the public garage a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: RobfromVA
Reviews.Content: I just booked through Booking.com. I selected this hotel because trip advisor said it has free parking. I noticed on my receipt that the hotel charges E 20 per day for parking. Booking.com would not let me cancel the reservation even though i omnly made it 2 minutes before i called.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PRegufe
Reviews.Content: This is a simple hotel well located near the tourist atractions in Madrid. The rooms are small but confortable. You have metro station near the hotel and you can reach the plaza mayor in a 10 minute walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Good location and great value. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Princess2708
Reviews.Content: I booked a room from Holiday Inn – Molins Barcelona, after the worst experience we decided to change our reservations in Madrid. We look for another hotel instead of staying at Holiday Inn – Madrid. Luckily we found HRC and they have only 2 rooms left. We booked the room for 4 nights stay and WOW I am very delighted. The rooms are quite small but very clean and well maintained. We have balcony and with a nice view. The hotel itself is small but the service, standards of the rooms, cleanliness, and service can rate into 4-5 Star. Good location, great value for money (we have free Wi-Fi and free drinks in the mini bar –), unfortunately we never tried the breakfast. I feel sorry for those people who had bad experience with this hotel. But actually it wasn’t the fault of the hotel it was just the culture in Madrid and people are really loud. But I advise for those light sleepers to make a request or comments when you book the room because I am pretty sure that HRC will do their best to accommodate the guest request. I haven’t book room with balcony but I did request to have a quiet room with nice view. And I’ve got the best room. Over all it is wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CinRoQ
Reviews.Content: The location was great since we loved to walk and were able to walk to the main squares that we wanted to while there. Customer service was also wonderful. I accidentally left my shoes under the bed and we had already checked out and were in the next city when we noticed. They held onto my shoes for 2 weeks while we were traveling through Southern Spain until we were back in Madrid. The only issue was a bar was located right beneath our window and we could hear the drunken patrons throughout the night, even though we were on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “No thrills. no frills”
Reviews.Author: Eva-Quirinius
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel to stay, friendly staff, nice hotels, but a bit away from nice locations. A tip: if you arrive at La Latina metro station, walk down the Toledo road, then Calatrava. It's a nicer and clearer trip than walking directly to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetsetTX
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a five night stay at HRC Hotel (that's the new name for Hotel Reyes Catolicos). After reading the reviews I booked a room (using TripAdvisor's comparison tool) through Booking.com. I've used them a few times in the past and highly recommend them for their great rates and the fact that they don't charge service fees like some others. Anyway, I booked it at an average rate of $67 per night, which I thought was great. There are better rates at hostals in Madrid and I looked into many but in the end decided on HRC because they had the most flexible cancellation policy (midnight the morning of your arrival or first night's rate) and the best reviews at the best price. I was not disappointed, in fact they did exceed my expectations. I did have to wait a bit for check as the gentleman was checking in a family and it seemed they had many questions, but it wasn't too bad, maybe five minutes? He checked me in quickly and I was on the way to my room (505) on the fifth floor (with a balcony, which I never imagined I would get). It was nice to have the balcony and the fifth floor room, it would have been a little nicer if the balcony had a chair and maybe a table, but still it was a great view! It was a small room, but I have stayed in smaller in Europe so I'm used to it, and not tiny by any means. There was a safe in the room, which I had read on here and I was very glad to see. There were several hangers and small drawers in the closet. There was a small desk, night stand, a chair, and a single bed in the room as it was a single room. The window/balcony door, don't worry it's more of a door but you do step over a low wall to go out was dressed sheer curtain. That might have been a problem for me after sunrise, had it not been for the roll down metal shutters on the outside which not only kept the room dark until I was ready to get out of bed and roll them up but also would have been great in the event of a hurricane. Hey, you never know = ) I truly appreciated those shutters because I have a very hard time sleeping with any light. Going out to the bars was on the agenda every night but one so I am glad they were there plus they were an added measure of security. The bathroom was pretty big for a single room, it had a bathtub if you're into baths and a rain shower head, which was honestly the first time I've stayed at a hotel with one of those (and I've stayed at many, many hotels, from bed and breakfasts, to budget hotels, to luxury hotels all over the world. Did I mention how exceptionally clean the room was? Well, it was. And so was the bathroom. The room had a tile floor and the bathroom had wood (probably of the faux variety. The bath towel had to be one of the largest bath towels I've had at a hotel as well. Heck, not just at a hotel, my bath towels are no where near that big. It was more like a beach towel and good quality too, not a cheap towel which you might expect for the price. Oh, the room had a mini bar (min fridge with water, soda, beer, etc. The prices were not bad actually, definitely not bad for a hotel mini-fridge. There is a small grocery store a few feet away though, and you can get everything cheaper there. The room was cleaned daily. Fortunately the cleaners didn't hit that floor until the early afternoon, but even when they were there before I got up I didn't hear them. And the one day I woke up after they were finished with my floor, they cleaned the room after I left (which I think was around 1:30 in the afternoon). I half expected to return that day with the room not cleaned but was pleasantly surprised. My only complaint about the cleaning service is that they didn't seem to like to leave much soap. When you arrive there's a little box with stuff including a very small bar of soap and a shower gel/shampoo among a few other items. I prefer bar soap over gel, and the gel was kind of watery so you'll pretty much use half a bottle of that for one shower, though they don't seem to be as skimpy with that stuff. I used the bar to wash my hands and take a shower but they didn't leave more until it was barely a sliver and then they only left one. One day, there was just over a sliver and I left it in the shower not the sink, but they didn't leave more. On my way out, I asked if I could get more and they had them at the desk so I said I would get one on my way back but then forgot so shower gel it was that next morning. One other thing about the room which I only noticed twice during my stay, was that I smelled cigarette smoke two nights, I assume it was coming from another room through the vents. It didn't really bother me that much but it was there, not strongly, but it was there. It was a good location, a few blocks from the Metro which gets you everywhere you want to go. Someone mentioned La Latina station but I think the station at Plaza de Toledo was closer, though it is down a slight hill so if it's a problem walking up a hill or you have lots or heavy luggage then La Latina might be better (though it was slightly more complicated getting to the hotel from there). I don't know how far the walk to Sol is, someone mentioned around fifteen minutes, I never walked there from the hotel. I did walk to other areas like Lavapies and Plaza de Santa Ana though and it's not too bad. I might have preferred being closer to the Sol or maybe Chueca area (for going to most of the gay bars), but like I said the Metro gets you there in no time so get a pass (it's well worth it). The Metro does stop running at 2AM, in Spain that is not very late. But a cab ride isn't all that expensive from that area to the hotel. Hope this review is helpful to you, I absolutely recommend this hotel without any hesitation! Like I said before, they actually exceeded my expectations and I would most definitely be glad to stay here again. Oh, almost forgot, fast free WiFi in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Good value choice”
Reviews.Author: kodix
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money. The hotel is in an interseting location if just a bit too far away from nearest Metro station. No problems at all and staff is friendly and helpful. Lovely cidreria next door is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our time here..”
Reviews.Author: Lingaro
Reviews.Content: Really good location, close to Plaza Mayor, Sol...We had a small room (501) but very clean and with a big balcony, excellent for sunbathing. Free Wifi and safe avaiable in the room.Allways friendly, helpfull staff. You can get to the hotel very easily from the airport by the undergrund for only 2 Euros. The area is full of tavernas and chilled tapas places. Don't miss the Sunday market in La Latina, which is only just a few streets away.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need :)”
Reviews.Author: sbutterf
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid in May and stayed at Hotel Reyes Catolicos. We got there quite early and took the metro to the hotel. We had no clue where we were going. But once we found the Hotel we felt at ease. The friendly staff accommodated us in an instant. Juan Manuel who was the hotel receptionist throughout our stay there was absolutely amazing. It was our first trip to Madrid and he suggested great places to eat, walk and for nightlife. We found ourselves in great places around the city. The hotel itself was very clean. Thank god! The bathroom was very spacious. Although this hotel is not too modern it sufficed for what we needed. It had AC, a spacious bathroom, comfortable beds, clean linens, a plasma tv, mini refrigerator, a safe to keep your valuables. All in all if I ever go back I would stay there! There is a club conveniently located about 20 feet away from the entrance of the hotel. We stayed at the hotel for about 4 nights and out of all 4 nights only 1 night did we wake up to a bit of a ruckous outside. All in all the staff is super helpful, the rooms are clean, and we did not worry about our safety as whoever came to the hotel was supervised.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, peekaboo view, great value”
Reviews.Author: Seattle07
Reviews.Content: Our rooms had views out over a vally, park and cathedral...all this just across the street from our hotel. In an area of flats and tiny tapas places only a few blocks from the tourist center of the city, and yet comfortably out of the tourist melee. Very clean, and helpful staff. At around $50Euros a night, this was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: sarcee
Reviews.Content: Good value,excellent location,very friendly and helpful staff. Snack bar excellent for cheap breakfast and drinks. Don't bring a large car if staying here,the underground car park is a squeeze ! Only drawback was that at end of April it was quite hot,and it seems A/C not turned on until May ! Made for some difficulty in sleeping initially.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for seeing Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sunnidafl
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the hotel's location...near cafes, the royal palace, Plaza Major, cathedral. The staff was very pleasant and spoke english. Small cafe attached to the lobby was a great place to stop in for a drink after sightseeing. Room was nice size and immaculate. Would recommend to anyone. Meant to write sooner!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: thegangof4inNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year's Eve and were very pleased! The staff let us check in very early and were very helpful in answering our questions. We made the reservation through a travel agent in Barcelona only a few days earlier. We had 2 double rooms; one for my husband and me, and the other for our two teenage children. The rooms had a terrace and we enjoyed the fireworks during the celebration of the new year. The neighborhood is less touristy and very convenient to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Reyes Catolicos for 10 days while visiting central Madrid. The location is great, right across the street from the big San Francisco church, and near the ronda de Toledo. Easy walk to the palace, to Plaza Mayor, to La Latina and the Rastro, and even over to the Conde Duque barrio. The staff was freindly - we speak a little spanish and that helped quite a bit. The desk staff always greeted us coming and going, the cleaning staff were attentive to the 'do not disturb' when we were sleeping late, which was every day it seemed, and the cafe staff new our breakfast order by day three. The room was nothing terribly fancy, small room and a small double bed for two. The bed was a little uncomfortable, but not terrible. Bathroom was nice and large and very clean. All in all, great location, average comfort, and perfectly nice staff. Decent price, too, given the bad exchange rates for US travelers right now, at about 90$ usd per night on average.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for 'low budget' this is it”
Reviews.Author: Brit63izzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Reyes Catolicos (Puerto de Toledo) - low budget. I wouldn’t recommend it unless you’re looking for somewhere just to lay your head. Two days were without hot water. The bathroom floor edges were dirty and sanitation questionable. There was no reason to go back to the hotel during any part of the day, except to call it a day and crash. But don’t expect to “crash” because from 10pm thru the very early hours (sometimes as late at 4am), the streets right outside the hotel were PACKED with people (young/old) partying, drinking and talking. A good pair of earplugs does the trick...just go with the flow, because you can’t change it. Now, with all that said, the bed was clean and comfortable. Oh, and no air conditioning. Call me a hotel snob, but this one just doesn’t make the list.

Reviews.Title: “NOT recommended!”
Reviews.Author: gug23
Reviews.Content: The desk staff are generally unfriendly and rude if something is asked of them. We had booked and paid for a double and when requesting a second set of towels/washcloths were rudely refused, without explanation. Aggressive gypsies congregate nearby, so be very cautious. I would never stay here again or recommend it. A local travel agent actually recommended it, I won't be back there!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but be cautious...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Dec 19 to Dec 26 2004. We've appreciated this hotel since it is conveniently located 10 minutes walking distance from a subway station and since it is located in a quiet environment. Also, it's within walking distance - 20 minutes - from the main tourist attractions located in Plaza Mayor and Plaza Puerta del Sol. The room was clean, comfortable and a very good value given the price and location. Now, a negative remark about this hotel: Management tried to charge us for items covered through internet reservation (5 Euros per person per day for breakfast + ITV (tax)), arguing that those items were not covered in the reservation, that the internet reservation site was faulty and that we had to support additional fees. Fortunately, we had "paper copies" of internet reservation and, after some "soft discussion" with management, we were able to make our point. All this to say, we would advice users to be cautious about this hotel (we don't know if it's really related to a misunderstanding between hotel and internet reservation site or a "general" policy of this hotel to charge costs covered in reservation) but, nevertheless, we would go back to this hotel without a doubt.
